timeline.message: revert variables that are added to operational layers

timeline.bodyText:
Not entirely related: do we actually have a character limit for lines?
I think in some samples we're just keeping the URL on one long line. Would be nice to keep it consistent :)
timeline.author: JonLavi

replies.bodyText: the character limit should be roughly 120 (if you haven't got it already there's a setting in IntelliJ you can use to show you the limit (File -> Settings -> Editor -> Code Style -> Hard wrap at: 120). This would be a good thing for us to doc in a Java sample contribution guide!  For this particular example,bit's way off the 120 line even when moving "new GeoprocessingTask" to a new line. So for examples like this it's fine to split for readability.
replies.author: Rachael-E

replies.bodyText: Yep, I have this set up already. However the Java API repo and the samples repo don't necessarily have the same code style convention. Was just trying to point out the inconsistency I've been seeing between samples
replies.author: JonLavi

timeline.bodyText:
Just for my own understanding: we need map as a member variable even if we're not using that object within it's own DoneLoadingListener?
I'm asking because in other cases we usually use the object itself inside the listener, but we don't do that here. The only actions are on the UI elements.
In other words: if we add a DoneLoadingListener to an Object, that Object needs to be a member var?
timeline.author: JonLavi

replies.bodyText: @colinanderson could you comment on this please? I think I was under the impression we would still need it so that there isn't potentially a reference lost for the addDoneLoadingListener, but perhaps it is just for cases when the loadable is called again within the done loading listener.
replies.author: Rachael-E
colinanderson

timeline.bodyText: Could we use this opportunity to rename the variable to selectedFeature? We've generally been doing that in samples, and I find it's clearer for users (although a lot more verbose).
timeline.author: JonLavi

timeline.bodyText:
Two sneaky spaces here are not needed

  
    
      
        Suggested change
timeline.author: JonLavi
JonLavi
JonLavi

timeline.bodyText:
I've just learnt that PictureMarkerSymbol are Loadable! Every day is a school day!
Are they affected by this problem as well, even though we don't add a DoneLoadingListener?
timeline.author: JonLavi

replies.bodyText: yes, an addDoneLoadingListener is used later in the method placePictureMarkerSymbol where a picture marker symbol is a parameter :)
replies.author: Rachael-E

replies.bodyText: Woops, I obviously completely missed that! Trying to do too many things at once, and failing a bit.
replies.author: JonLavi

timeline.bodyText: @Rachael-E this looks like a listenable future which won't get garbage collected.
timeline.author: mbcoder
